abstract.text: Renders the glyphs at the specified positions, using the specified attributes.

inlineContent.text: The glyphs to draw, which may include embedded
bytes.
The positions at which to draw the glyphs in the user space coordinate system.
The number of glyphs to draw.
The font to apply to the graphics state. This value can be different from the
value in the
argument because of various font substitutions that the system automatically executes.
The affine transform mapping the text space coordinate system to the user space coordinate system. The
and
components of
are ignored because Quartz overrides them with the glyph positions.

The layout manager calls this primitive method when it is time to lay out a set of glyphs in the specified graphics context.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
The representation of a font in an app.
An object that coordinates the layout and display of text characters.
Draws background marks for the specified glyphs, which must lie completely within a single text container.
Draws the specified glyphs, which must lie completely within a single text container.
Draws a strikethrough for the specified glyphs.
Draws underlining for the glyphs in a specified range.
Fills background rectangles with a color.
Renders the glyphs at the specified positions, using the specified attributes.
Calculates and draws strikethrough for the specified glyphs.
Calculates subranges to underline for the specified glyphs and draws the underlining as appropriate.
Attributes that are used only inside the glyph generation machinery, but must also be shared between components.
The font of the text.
An affine transformation matrix for use in drawing 2D graphics.
A structure that contains a point in a two-dimensional coordinate system.
A Quartz 2D drawing environment.
An index into the internal glyph table of a font.
The attributes you apply to ranges of characters in an attributed string.
Describes an integer.
A string of text that manages data, layout, and stylistic information for ranges of characters to support rendering.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A signed integer value type.
